noun.description: A short, slender, sharp-pointed outgrowth on the bark or epidermis of a plant; a small thorn.
examples: the prickles of the blackberry bushes

verb.description: (of a person's skin or a part of the body) experience a tingling sensation, especially as a result of strong emotion.
examples: the sound made her skin prickle with horror

origin: Old English pricel instrument for pricking, sensation of being pricked; related to Middle Dutch prickel, from the Germanic base of prick. The verb is partly a diminutive of the verb prick.
